questions.question: How do I install the fexli-util-node-comfyui custom node manually?
questions.answer:
To install manually, switch to your project's root directory, then run the following commands:
cd custom_nodes
git clone https://github.com/fexli/fexli-util-node-comfyui.git
cd fexli-util-node-comfyui
pip install -r requirements.txt
questions.subject: fexli-util-node-comfyui

questions.question: What is the process to install the fexli-util-node-comfyui using comfyui-manager?
questions.answer: Open ComfyUI WebUI, navigate to `Manager` -> `Install Custom Node`, enter `fexli-util-node-comfyui` in the `Search` field and click `Search`, then click `Install`.
questions.subject: fexli-util-node-comfyui

questions.question: How do I configure the `config.yaml` file for fexli-util-node-comfyui?
questions.answer: Move the `config_example.yaml` file to `config.yaml` and fill in the fields with your bc docker infer api, openai key, and optionally openai proxy.
questions.subject: fexli-util-node-comfyui

questions.question: What fields need to be filled in the `config.yaml` file for the fexli-util-node-comfyui custom node?
questions.answer: You need to fill in the bc_docker_api, openai_key, and optionally openai_host fields in the `config.yaml` file.
questions.subject: fexli-util-node-comfyui
